alert.note: Alert for Cuyahoga; Geauga; Lake; Portage; Summit; Trumbull (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 18 at 5:04PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...An intense lake effect snow band will affect northwestern Portage...northwestern Trumbull...Geauga...southeastern Cuyahoga... southern Lake...northeastern Summit and Ashtabula Counties Until 600 PM EDT.... At 503 PM EDT, radar indicated an intense lake effect snow band along a line extending from 8 miles northwest of Andover to near Parma, moving east at 10 mph. Webcams indicate brief visibility to less than a quarter of a mile and snow-covered roads under this band. Accidents have occurred along I-90 in Lake County. HAZARDS INCLUDE... Winds to 30 mph... Visibility rapidly dropping to less than a quarter of a mile... Sudden changes in road conditions... Locations impacted include... Cleveland, Painesville, Chardon, Parma, Euclid, Mentor, Cleveland Heights, Solon, Willoughby, Twinsburg, Streetsboro, Warrensville Heights, Macedonia, Geneva, South Russell, Madison, Middlefield, Perry, Orwell and Burton. Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this lake effect snow band. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads are likely to lead to accidents. Consider delaying travel until this snow band passes your location. && ODOT DMS 302, 304, 306, 307, 308, 314, 315, 317, 318, 319, 320, 322, 323, 324, 328, 329, 330, 331, and 332.
